page.title: 08Ellacombe Primary School
page.content: The school was built in 1867. It was a church school and was for boys only. The Girls' School was added later and the Infants' School later still. One of our Governers came into school to tell us what it was like when he was here in 1928. Then children left at the age of 14. They could go to the Grammar School if they were selected and then they left at 16 years old. Today there are 361 children in the school. The largest class contains 39 children. There are 15.5 teachers (the 0.5 only works during the summer term.) The secretary works for 4 days a week. There is a caretaker (full time) and 2 cleaners who work for 14.75 hours per week.
